planets.name: Mercury
planets.description: The smallest planet in our solar system and nearest to the Sun, Mercury is only slightly larger than Earth's Moon. Its surface is heavily cratered and experiences extreme temperature variations.
planets.composition: Rocky planet with a large iron core making up 75% of its radius
interestingFacts: Mercury has the most eccentric orbit of all planets
It has no atmosphere to retain heat, causing extreme temperature swings
A day on Mercury lasts longer than its year
It has water ice in permanently shadowed polar craters
Mercury's core is unusually large relative to its size

planets.name: Venus
planets.description: Venus is the second planet from the Sun and is Earth's closest planetary neighbor. It's the hottest planet in our solar system due to its thick, toxic atmosphere that traps heat.
planets.composition: Rocky planet with dense CO₂ atmosphere and sulfuric acid clouds
interestingFacts: Venus rotates backwards compared to most planets
It has the densest atmosphere of the terrestrial planets
Surface pressure is 90 times that of Earth
It's often called Earth's 'evil twin' due to similar size
Venus is the brightest planet in our sky after the Sun and Moon

planets.name: Earth
planets.description: Our home planet is the third planet from the Sun, and the only place we know of so far that's inhabited by living things. Earth's unique conditions make it perfect for life as we know it.
planets.composition: Rocky planet with 71% water surface and nitrogen-oxygen atmosphere
interestingFacts: The only known planet with life
Has a magnetic field that protects from solar radiation
About 71% of Earth's surface is covered with water
The Moon stabilizes Earth's axial tilt
Earth's atmosphere is 78% nitrogen and 21% oxygen

planets.name: Mars
planets.description: Mars is the fourth planet from the Sun – a dusty, cold, desert world with a very thin atmosphere. Known as the Red Planet due to iron oxide on its surface.
planets.composition: Rocky planet with iron oxide surface and thin CO₂ atmosphere
interestingFacts: Home to the largest volcano in the solar system (Olympus Mons)
Has polar ice caps made of water and carbon dioxide
A day on Mars is very similar to a day on Earth
Evidence suggests Mars once had liquid water
Mars has the largest dust storms in the solar system

planets.name: Jupiter
planets.description: Jupiter is the largest planet in our solar system – if it were a hollow shell, 1,000 Earths could fit inside. This gas giant acts as a cosmic vacuum cleaner, protecting inner planets.
planets.composition: Gas giant primarily hydrogen (89%) and helium (10%)
interestingFacts: The Great Red Spot is a storm larger than Earth that has raged for centuries
Jupiter has the shortest day of all planets
It acts as a 'cosmic vacuum cleaner' protecting inner planets
Jupiter has a faint ring system discovered in 1979
Its moon Europa may harbor a subsurface ocean

planets.name: Saturn
planets.description: Saturn is the sixth planet from the Sun and the second largest planet in our solar system, famous for its spectacular ring system made of ice and rock particles.
planets.composition: Gas giant less dense than water, primarily hydrogen and helium
interestingFacts: Saturn would float in water if there were a bathtub big enough
Its rings are made mostly of ice particles ranging from tiny grains to house-sized chunks
Saturn has the most extensive and visible ring system
Its moon Titan has lakes of liquid methane and ethane
Saturn's hexagonal storm at its north pole is larger than Earth

planets.name: Uranus
planets.description: Uranus is the seventh planet from the Sun and has the third-largest planetary radius and fourth-largest planetary mass in the Solar System. It's an ice giant that rotates on its side.
planets.composition: Ice giant with water, methane, and ammonia ices
interestingFacts: Uranus rotates on its side at a 98-degree angle
It has faint rings discovered in 1977
The planet appears blue-green due to methane in its atmosphere
It's the coldest planetary atmosphere in the solar system
Uranus has extreme seasons lasting 21 Earth years each

planets.name: Neptune
planets.description: Neptune is the eighth and outermost planet in our solar system, known for its dynamic and active atmosphere with the fastest winds in the solar system.
planets.composition: Ice giant with fastest winds in solar system up to 2,100 km/h
interestingFacts: Neptune has the strongest winds in the solar system (up to 2,100 km/h)
It was the first planet located through mathematical predictions
A year on Neptune equals 165 Earth years
Its largest moon Triton orbits backwards and may be a captured Kuiper Belt object
Neptune radiates 2.6 times more energy than it receives from the Sun

planets.name: Kepler-452b
planets.description: Known as Earth's 'cousin', Kepler-452b is an exoplanet orbiting within the habitable zone of a Sun-like star. It's about 60% larger than Earth and located 1,400 light-years away.
planets.composition: Likely rocky with possible atmosphere and water
interestingFacts: First near-Earth-size planet in the habitable zone of a Sun-like star
Receives 10% more energy from its star than Earth does from the Sun
Its star is 6 billion years old, 1.5 billion years older than our Sun
Could potentially have liquid water on its surface
Discovered by NASA's Kepler Space Telescope in 2015

planets.name: Proxima Centauri b
planets.description: The closest known exoplanet to Earth, orbiting within the habitable zone of Proxima Centauri, our nearest stellar neighbor at just 4.24 light-years away.
planets.composition: Likely rocky, tidally locked to its star
interestingFacts: The closest potentially habitable exoplanet to Earth
Orbits a red dwarf star much smaller and cooler than our Sun
Likely tidally locked with one side always facing its star
Could have liquid water despite being much closer to its star
Target for future interstellar missions like Breakthrough Starshot

stars.name: The Sun
stars.description: The Sun is the star at the center of the Solar System. It is a nearly perfect sphere of hot plasma, heated to incandescence by nuclear fusion reactions in its core.
interestingFacts: The Sun contains 99.86% of the mass in the Solar System
Every second, the Sun converts 600 million tons of hydrogen into helium
Light from the Sun takes 8 minutes and 20 seconds to reach Earth
The Sun's core temperature reaches 15.7 million degrees Celsius
The Sun will become a red giant in about 5 billion years

stars.name: Proxima Centauri
stars.description: Proxima Centauri is the closest star to the Sun, located 4.24 light-years away. It's a red dwarf star that's much smaller and cooler than our Sun.
stars.composition: Red dwarf with frequent stellar flares
interestingFacts: The closest star to our Solar System
Part of the Alpha Centauri star system
Much smaller and dimmer than our Sun
Has at least two confirmed exoplanets
Experiences frequent and powerful stellar flares

stars.name: Betelgeuse
stars.description: Betelgeuse is one of the largest known stars and a red supergiant in the constellation Orion. It's expected to explode as a supernova within the next 100,000 years.
stars.composition: Red supergiant nearing end of stellar evolution
interestingFacts: One of the largest known stars by volume
If placed at the center of our Solar System, it would engulf Mars
Expected to explode as a supernova in the next 100,000 years
Its brightness varies significantly over time
When it explodes, it will be visible during the day for weeks

stars.name: Sirius
stars.description: Sirius is the brightest star in the night sky and consists of a binary star system with a main-sequence star and a white dwarf companion.
stars.composition: A-type main-sequence star with white dwarf companion
interestingFacts: The brightest star in the night sky
Actually a binary star system
Known as the 'Dog Star' in the constellation Canis Major
Its white dwarf companion was one of the first white dwarfs discovered
Twice as massive and 25 times more luminous than the Sun

galaxies.name: Milky Way Galaxy
galaxies.description: Our home galaxy, the Milky Way, is a barred spiral galaxy containing over 100 billion stars, including our Solar System located in one of its spiral arms.
galaxies.composition: Spiral galaxy with central bar, spiral arms, and dark matter halo
interestingFacts: Contains our Solar System in the Orion Arm
The supermassive black hole at its center is called Sagittarius A*
It's on a collision course with the Andromeda Galaxy
Most of its mass is dark matter
It rotates once every 225-250 million years

galaxies.name: Andromeda Galaxy
galaxies.description: The Andromeda Galaxy is a spiral galaxy approximately 2.5 million light-years from Earth and the nearest major galaxy to the Milky Way.
galaxies.composition: Spiral galaxy with prominent dust lanes and star-forming regions
interestingFacts: It's on a collision course with the Milky Way
The collision will occur in about 4.5 billion years
It's the most distant object visible to the naked eye
Contains about twice as many stars as the Milky Way
Also known as Messier 31 or M31

galaxies.name: Messier 87
galaxies.description: Messier 87 is a supergiant elliptical galaxy famous for containing the first black hole ever directly imaged by the Event Horizon Telescope.
galaxies.composition: Elliptical galaxy with supermassive black hole and relativistic jet
interestingFacts: Home to the first black hole ever directly imaged
Its central black hole has a mass of 6.5 billion suns
Produces a relativistic jet extending 5,000 light-years
One of the most massive galaxies in the local universe
Located in the Virgo galaxy cluster

asteroids.name: Ceres
asteroids.description: Ceres is the largest object in the asteroid belt and the only dwarf planet in the inner solar system. It contains about one-third of the asteroid belt's total mass.
asteroids.composition: Rocky core with water-ice mantle and possible subsurface ocean
interestingFacts: The largest object in the asteroid belt
Contains about one-third of the asteroid belt's total mass
May have a subsurface ocean beneath its icy crust
Has bright spots that are likely salt deposits
First asteroid discovered (1801) and later reclassified as a dwarf planet

asteroids.name: Vesta
asteroids.description: Vesta is the second-largest asteroid in the asteroid belt and the brightest asteroid visible from Earth. It has a differentiated interior similar to terrestrial planets.
asteroids.composition: Differentiated asteroid with basaltic surface and iron core
interestingFacts: The brightest asteroid visible from Earth
Has a differentiated interior like terrestrial planets
Source of many meteorites found on Earth
Has a giant impact crater covering much of its southern hemisphere
Visited by NASA's Dawn spacecraft from 2011-2012

asteroids.name: 433 Eros
asteroids.description: Eros is a near-Earth asteroid and the first asteroid to be orbited and landed on by a spacecraft. It's elongated and peanut-shaped.
asteroids.composition: S-type asteroid rich in silicates and metals
interestingFacts: First asteroid to be orbited by a spacecraft (NEAR Shoemaker)
Has an elongated, peanut-like shape
Rotates once every 5.27 hours
Contains enough gold to supply Earth for years
Classified as a potentially hazardous asteroid

comets.name: Halley's Comet
comets.description: Halley's Comet is the most famous comet, visible from Earth every 75-76 years. It's the only known short-period comet that is regularly visible to the naked eye.
comets.composition: Dirty snowball of ice, dust, and rocky material
interestingFacts: The most famous comet, visible every 75-76 years
Last visible from Earth in 1986, next appearance in 2061
Has been recorded by astronomers for over 2,000 years
Its tail can extend over 100 million kilometers
Named after Edmond Halley who calculated its orbit

comets.name: Hale-Bopp
comets.description: Comet Hale-Bopp was one of the most widely observed comets of the 20th century and was visible to the naked eye for a record 18 months.
comets.composition: Large nucleus with high dust and gas production
interestingFacts: Visible to the naked eye for a record 18 months
One of the brightest comets of the 20th century
Has an unusually large nucleus for a comet
Discovered independently by Alan Hale and Thomas Bopp
Won't return to the inner solar system for about 2,500 years

comets.name: NEOWISE
comets.description: Comet NEOWISE was the brightest comet visible from Earth in over 20 years when it appeared in 2020, providing spectacular views for skywatchers worldwide.
comets.composition: Pristine material from the early solar system
interestingFacts: The brightest comet visible from Earth in over 20 years
Discovered by NASA's NEOWISE space telescope
Visible to the naked eye for several weeks in 2020
Contains pristine material from the formation of the solar system
Won't return for nearly 7,000 years

nebulae.name: Orion Nebula
nebulae.description: The Orion Nebula is one of the brightest nebulae visible to the naked eye and is a stellar nursery where new stars are being born.
nebulae.composition: Hydrogen, helium, and heavier elements ionized by young hot stars
interestingFacts: One of the brightest nebulae visible to the naked eye
A stellar nursery where new stars are actively forming
Contains the Trapezium Cluster of hot young stars
Visible in the constellation Orion
About 24 light-years across

nebulae.name: Crab Nebula
nebulae.description: The Crab Nebula is a supernova remnant from a star that exploded in 1054 CE, containing a pulsar at its center spinning 30 times per second.
nebulae.composition: Expanding shell of gas and dust from supernova explosion
interestingFacts: Remnant of a supernova observed by Chinese astronomers in 1054 CE
Contains a pulsar spinning 30 times per second
Expanding at 1,500 kilometers per second
One of the most studied objects in astronomy
Emits radiation across the entire electromagnetic spectrum

nebulae.name: Eagle Nebula
nebulae.description: The Eagle Nebula is famous for the 'Pillars of Creation' - towering columns of gas and dust where new stars are being born.
nebulae.composition: Dense columns of gas and dust forming new stars
interestingFacts: Home to the famous 'Pillars of Creation'
Active star-forming region with newborn stars
The pillars are several light-years tall
Contains elephant trunk structures of dense gas
Photographed by the Hubble Space Telescope

blackholes.name: Sagittarius A*
blackholes.description: Sagittarius A* is the supermassive black hole at the center of our galaxy, the Milky Way. It was the second black hole to be directly imaged.
blackholes.composition: Supermassive black hole with accretion disk
interestingFacts: The supermassive black hole at the center of our galaxy
Second black hole to be directly imaged (2022)
Stars orbit around it at incredible speeds
Nothing can escape once it crosses the event horizon
Its gravity affects the orbits of nearby stars

blackholes.name: M87* Black Hole
blackholes.description: The supermassive black hole at the center of galaxy M87, famous for being the first black hole ever directly imaged by the Event Horizon Telescope.
blackholes.composition: Supermassive black hole with relativistic jet
interestingFacts: First black hole ever directly imaged (2019)
1,600 times more massive than Sagittarius A*
Produces a relativistic jet extending thousands of light-years
Located in the center of galaxy Messier 87
The image showed the black hole's shadow and glowing accretion disk
